member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.RaiseEventSafe(System.Delegate,System.Object[]@)
member.summary: Triggers an event declared at module level within a class, form, or document in a thread-safe manner.
member.param: The event to be raised.
The arguements for the event.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Connected
member.summary: Occurs when connection is achieved (client and server).

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.ConnectionRequest
member.summary: Occurs on the server when a client is attempting to connect.
member.remarks: Client registers connected at this point. Server must Accept in order for it to be connected.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.DataArrival
member.summary: Occurs when data arrives on the socket.
member.remarks: Raised only after all parts of the data have been collected.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Disconnected
member.summary: Occurs when disconnected from the remote computer (client and server).

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.ErrorReceived
member.summary: Occurs when an error is detected in the socket.
member.remarks: May also be raised on disconnected (depending on disconnect circumstance).

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.ReceiveProgress
member.summary: Occurs while the receive buffer is being filled with data.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.SendComplete
member.summary: Occurs when sending of data is completed.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.SendProgress
member.summary: Occurs when the send buffer has been sent but not all the data has been sent yet.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.StateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the state of the socket changes.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.ChangeLocalPort(System.Int32)
member.summary: When the port is set dynamically by using port 0, the socket can now update the property of the component.
member.param: The port we are now listening on.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.BufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the interal size of the byte buffers.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.HasData
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the buffer has data for retrieval.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.LegacySupport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if Legacy support should be used or not.
member.remarks: Legacy support is to support older winsock style connections.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.LocalIP
member.summary: Gets the local machine's IP address(es).

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.LocalPort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the port the see cref="WinsockBase" control should listen on.
member.remarks: Cannot change while listening, connected, or connecting - but can change while closing.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.MaxPendingConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that control the length of the maximum length of the pending connections queue.
member.remarks: Cannot change while listening.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.NetworkStream
member.summary: Gets a NetworkStream that this WinsockBase object is based on.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Protocol
member.summary: Gets or sets the winsock protocol to use when communicating with the remote computer.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.RemoteHost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines what remote computer to connect to, or is currently connected to.
member.remarks: Can only change if closed or listening.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.RemotePort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines which port on the remote computer to connect on, or is currently connected on.
member.remarks: Can only change if closed or listening.

member.summary: Gets the state of the see cref="WinsockBase" WinsockBase control.

member.summary: Creates an new see cref="WinsockBase" WinsockBase see and accepts the client connection on it.
member.param: A System.Net.Sockets.Socket that represents the client being accepted.
member.remarks: This was created to be used by the listener, to keep the listener listening while also accepting a connection.

member.summary: Closes an open see cref="WinsockBase" WinsockBase see connection.

member.summary: Establishes a connection to a remote host.

A value indicating the port on the remote host to connect to.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Send(System.Object)
member.summary: Sends an object to a connected socket on a remote computer.
member.param: The object to send.
member.remarks: The object is first serialized using a BinaryFormatter - unless it is already a byte array, in which case it just sends the byte array.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.SendFile(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a file to a connected socket on a remote computer.
member.param: The full path to the file you want to send.
member.remarks: Creates a special file object to send, so the receiving end knows what to do with it.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Get
member.summary: Gets the next object from the buffer, removing it from the buffer.
member.returns: A Deserialized object or if it can't be deserialized the byte array.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Get``1
member.summary: Gets the next object from the buffer as the supplied type, removing it from the buffer.
member.typeparam: The System.Type you wish to have the data returned as.
member.returns: A Deserialized object converted to the data type you wish.
member.remarks: This function was added to make it easier for Option Strict users. It allows for easier conversion instead of the user using CType, DirectCast, or the like. Can throw an error if you specify the wrong type.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Peek
member.summary: Gets the next object from the buffer, leaving it ing the buffer.
member.returns: A Deserialized object or if it can't be deserialized the byte array.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.OWinsockBase.Peek``1
member.summary: Gets the next object from the buffer as the supplied type, leaving it in the buffer.
member.typeparam: The System.Type you wish to have the data returned as.
member.returns: A Deserialized object converted to the data type you wish.
member.remarks: This function was added to make it easier for Option Strict users. It allows for easier conversion instead of the user using CType, DirectCast, or the like. Can throw an error if you specify the wrong type.

member.name: F:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.llList
member.summary: Stores the list of items within this instance.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Deque class that is empty and has the default initial capacity.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.#ctor(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Deque class that contains elements copied from the specified collection and has sufficient capacity to accommodate the number of elements copied.
member.param: The collection whose elements are copied to the new Deque.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the entire Deque to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
member.param: The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from Deque. The Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements actually contained in the Deque.
member.value: The number of elements actually contained in the Deque.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe).
member.value: true if access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, false. In the default implementation of List, this property always returns false.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection.
member.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection. In the default implementation of List, this property always returns the current instance.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the Queue.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Clone
member.summary: Creates a shallow copy of the Queue.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Clear
member.summary: Removes all elements from the Deque.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether an element is in the Deque.
member.param: The object to locate in the Deque. The value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for reference types.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Peek``1
member.summary: Returns the object at the beginning (top) of the Deque without removing it.
member.returns: The object at the beginning (top) of the Deque.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.ToArray
member.summary: Copies the elements of the Deque to a new array.
member.returns: An array containing copies of the elements of the Deque.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.ToString
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the current Object.
member.returns: A String that represents the current Object.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Dequeue``1
member.summary: Removes and returns the object at the beginning of the Deque.
member.returns: The object that is removed from the beginning of the Deque.
member.remarks: Synonymous with Pop().

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Enqueue(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an object to the end of the Deque.
member.param: The object to add to the Deque. The value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Pop``1
member.summary: Removes and returns the object at the top of the Deque.
member.returns: The Object removed from the top of the Deque.
member.remarks: Synonymous with Dequeue().

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.Deque.Push(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts an object at the top of the Deque.
member.param: The Object to push onto the Deque. The value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:Orbita.Winsock.Deque
member.summary: Represents both a last-in, first-out (LIFO) and a first-in, first-out (FIFO) non-generic collection of objects.
member.remarks:
While the System.Collections.Stack and the System.Collections.Queue have seemingly different ways of operating, they can be combined easily by just manipulating the way in which an item in inserted into the list.
This allows the removal from the list to remain the same, whether you are treating this class like a Stack or a Queue. The also allows the Peek() method to work for both at the same time.
Helping tidbit - Deque is pronounced like "deck."

member.summary: Deserializes an object from a byte array.

member.name: T:Orbita.Winsock.ObjectPacker
member.summary: Contains function for serializing/deserializing an object to and from a byte array.

member.name: M:Orbita.Winsock.WinsockCollection.OnClearComplete

member.summary: The IPEndPoint that contains the IP address information needed to send the data.

member.name: P:Orbita.Winsock.AsyncSocket.SendQueueData.Data
member.summary: The data that needs to be sent.

member.name: T:Orbita.Winsock.AsyncSocket.SendQueueData
member.summary: A class that helps store data waiting to be sent in the SendQueue
member.remarks: This class was borne out of necessity - not for TCP, but for UDP. I realized that if you are sending large data chunks out via UDP to different remote addresses, you could end up sending data to the wrong remote host. This class allows the component to recognize that it needs to send to a different remote host.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.Connected
member.summary: Occurs when connection is achieved (client and server).

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.ConnectionRequest
member.summary: Occurs on the server when a client is attempting to connect.
member.remarks: Client registers connected at this point. Server must Accept in order for it to be connected.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.DataArrival
member.summary: Occurs when data arrives on the socket.
member.remarks: Raised only after all parts of the data have been collected.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.Disconnected
member.summary: Occurs when disconnected from the remote computer (client and server).

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.ErrorReceived
member.summary: Occurs when an error is detected in the socket.
member.remarks: May also be raised on disconnected (depending on disconnect circumstance).

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.ReceiveProgress
member.summary: Occurs while the receive buffer is being filled with data.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.SendComplete
member.summary: Occurs when sending of data is completed.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.SendProgress
member.summary: Occurs when the send buffer has been sent but not all the data has been sent yet.

member.name: E:Orbita.Winsock.IWinsock.StateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the state of the socket changes.
